contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Echatfield.jpg|thumb|200px|Lord Chatfield.]] '''Baron Chatfield''', of Ditchling in the County of Sussex, was a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created in 1937 for the naval commander [[Ernle Chatfield, 1st Baron Chatfield|Sir Ernle Chatfield]]. The title became extinct on the death of his son, the second Baron, in 2007. ==Barons Chatfield (1937)== *[[Ernle Chatfield, 1st Baron Chatfield|(Alfred) Ernle (Montacute) Chatfield, 1st Baron Chatfield]] (1873–1967) *Ernle David Lewis Chatfield, 2nd Baron Chatfield (1917–2007) ==Notes== {{unreferenced|date=February 2013}} {{reflist}} ==References== *Kidd, Charles, Williamson, David (editors). ''Debrett's Peerage and Baronetage'' (1990 edition). New York: St Martin's Press, 1990, {{Page needed |date=February 2013}} *{{Rayment|date=February 2012}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Chatfield}} [[Category:Baronies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Extinct baronies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]]
